DOC.brief_summary: The objective study test whether two different participant financial incentive structure effective cost effective minimal financial incentive increase weight loss among Minnesota Medicaid beneficiary high risk develop diabetes . The incentive tie participation weight loss evidence-based group-delivered YMCA diabetes prevention program ( Y-DPP ) . The Investigators conduct group randomize trial include 150 Y-DPP class 10-15 participant per class 1500 Medicaid beneficiary participate Y-DPP class . This approach , successful , ( ) improve weight loss . diabetes risk , improve cardiovascular risk among Medicaid beneficiary risk develop diabetes chronic condition , ( b ) demonstrate prevention chronic disease risk factor use patient incentive cost-effective , ( c ) provide patient incentive model widely use among Medicaid beneficiary risk develop diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Minnesota Medicaid Incentives Prevent Chronic Disease
DOC.criteria: currently enrol Medical Assistance , PMAP , MinnesotaCare ( collectively refer Medicaid ) 1875 year age body mass index ≥ 25 kg/m2 ( ≥ 22 kg/m2 Asian descent ) prediabetes history gestational diabetes mellitus ( GDM ) diagnosis diabetes pregnant time enrollment plan gastric bypass surgery within next 12 month diagnose Alzheimer 's disease ( ICD9 331.0 ) dementia ( ICD9 290.0 294.9 ) provider judgment regard suitability study base substance abuse , uncontrolled mental illness , condition may affect participant health ability participate study .
